https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-dirtables-manage#label-directory-table-refreshes
Directory tables on internal stages require manual metadata refreshes.
This command creates an internal Snowflake stage since it doesn't specify an external cloud storage location.
I ran this command in Snowflake and it was valid and using SHOW STAGES; I validated that it was an internal stage, so the answer is B
Answer is A, test it in your snow account.

Selected Answer: A
Checked on Snowflake

choices.C: An error will be received stating that the storage location for the stage must be identified when creating a stage with a directory table.
choices.D: The command will fail to run because the name of the directory table is not specified.
choices.B: A stage with a directory table that has metadata that must be manually refreshed will be created.
choices.A: A stage with a directory table set to automatically refresh will be created.

questions.question_text:
A user creates a stage using the following command:


CREATE STAGE mystage -
DIRECTORY = (ENABLE = TRUE)
FILE_FORMAT = myformat;

What will be the outcome?
Which statistics on a Query Profile reflect the efficiency of the query pruning? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Statistics

A major source of information provided in the detail pane is the various statistics, grouped in the following sections:

 Pruning — information on the effects of table pruning:

 Partitions scanned — number of partitions scanned so far.
 Partitions total — total number of partitions in a given table.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/ui-query-profile

Selected Answer: B
Agree with B although it's a trick question

Selected Answer: B
Answer is asking operations, Alter is not an operation, its modification so answer is JOIN operation in a query

Selected Answer: D
External tables can be dropped. So ALTER.

Selected Answer: B
You cannot alter extrenal tables in any way

comments.content: ALTER is not a DML statement but a DDL. And yes, DDL statements like DROP is allowed. So ALTER is the answer.

discussion.content:
Answer "B" is correct.
External tables are read-only. You cannot perform data manipulation language
(DML) operations on them. However, you can use external tables for query and join operations. You can also create views against external tables.

B. JOIN
External tables in Snowflake can participate in JOIN operations with other tables, whether they are external or internal.
D is correct

comments.content: If ALTER is not an operation, then what is it?

discussion.content:
Option B is the answer.
Kindly read the question "Which Operation can be performed" 
Join is an operation in database but not alter.

comments.content: Alter external table operates on the external table's metadata, not on the data in the external table itself. but queries and joins on the external table is allowed. B

Correct, so DML operations cannot be performed (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE).
ALTER is DDL.

Because Snowflake utilizes per-second billing (with a 60-second minimum each time the warehouse starts), warehouses are billed only for the credits they actually consume when they are actively working.

questions.question_text: True or False: Snowflake bills for a minimum of five minutes each time a Virtual Warehouse is started.
